motions.title: Consent Agenda Approval
motions.description: Approval of consent agenda including: • August 8, 2022, City Council meeting minutes • Contract with Triscapes for road and stormwater maintenance

motions.title: Text Amendment to Regulate Materials for Residential Driveways (Second Read)
motions.description: Second read approval of text amendment with Option 2 allowing gravel and 35% street yard coverage with standards.

motions.title: North Metro SWAT Memorandum of Understanding Adding Chamblee Police Department
motions.description: Approval of North Metro SWAT Memorandum of Understanding adding Chamblee Police Department to the agreement.

presentations.title: Edge City 2.0 Project Update
presentations.description: Update on Edge City 2.0 project (Perimeter area) with three scenarios: A – Live+ Walk, B – Gather, and C - Transit-Oriented.

presentations.title: Retreat 2022 - Update
presentations.description: Update on the status of items from the 2022 City Council Retreat list.

discussionItems.title: Dunwoody Entrepreneurship & Innovation Strategy
discussionItems.description: Overview of Entrepreneurship/Innovation Strategy with $250,000 CARES II funding. Five goals to develop thriving entrepreneurial ecosystem. Part-time administrator hired shared with Community Development.

discussionItems.title: Discussion of Options for Easing Alcohol Licensing Requirements for Businesses
discussionItems.description: Options for reducing food sales requirement from 60% to 50% and allowing alcohol sales up to 50%. Council asked staff to explore options with police department involvement.

discussionItems.title: Bikeway Policy Discussion
discussionItems.description: Bikeway policy information for determining what type of cyclists to serve and priority routes. Recommendation to coordinate with The Path Foundation.

discussionItems.title: Discussion of a Contract Award for Installation of Holiday Lights at Brook Run Park
discussionItems.description: Request for award of contract to Chitwood Studios for $80,000 (same as last year) with 10% contingency for total not-to-exceed $88,000. Event runs December 1-31.

discussionItems.title: Discussion of Park Naming Campaign
discussionItems.description: Direction on park naming with Council suggesting geographical, unique, or historical elements rather than naming after people. Perimeter Center East identified as most critical need.

discussionItems.title: Revision of City of Dunwoody Mission and Vision Statements
discussionItems.description: Proposed Vision Statement: 'Dunwoody is a thriving, vibrant, inclusive community with exceptional opportunities.'

discussionItems.title: Update on Bond Timelines for 2023
discussionItems.description: Update on bond timelines with suggestion for citizen committee with one citizen per council member. Mayor to form Capital Improvement Project Citizen Advisory Committee with Council Member Lambert as chair.

discussionItems.title: Resolution for Budget Amendment for Fiscal Year 2022
